title: Privacy Policy
intro: This Privacy Policy explains how {{brand}} collects, uses, shares, and safeguards your information when you use our websites, apps, and related services (collectively, the “Service”). If you do not agree with this Policy, please do not use the Service.

amplitude.categories: Usage events, device info, approximate location, identifiers

data.title: 1. Data we collect

items.identifiers: Identifiers: email, name (optional), username, profile photo.
items.vibe: “Vibe” content you create (profiles, links, descriptions, icons, QR data, settings).

items.events: Event analytics (e.g., create/share/open Vibe, button clicks), session duration.
items.device: Approximate location (by IP), device/OS, browser, language, referrer/UTM.

items.messages: Emails/messages you send us; bug reports and diagnostics.
items.billing: Billing or subscription info (if you buy paid features; processed by our providers).

data.note: We do not sell personal information. We also do not intentionally collect sensitive categories unless you directly provide them in free-text fields (please avoid sharing sensitive data there).

items.provide: Provide and operate the Service (account creation, authentication, rendering your Vibes).
items.improve: Improve UX and performance (measure load times, flows, and feature adoption).
items.personalize: Personalize content (e.g., default language/region, recently used blocks).
items.security: Security, fraud prevention, and abuse detection.
items.communicate: Communicate with you about updates, tips, or important notices.
items.legal: Comply with legal obligations and enforce our <termsLink>{{terms}}</termsLink>.

contract.title: Contract
contract.text: to provide the Service you request.

legit.title: Legitimate interests
legit.text: analytics, improvement, and security (balanced with your rights).

consent.title: Consent
consent.text: where required for optional cookies/SDKs or marketing emails.

obligation.title: Legal obligation
obligation.text: responding to lawful requests and recordkeeping duties.

sharing.title: 4. Sharing & processors
sharing.intro: We share data with service providers who process it on our behalf, under contracts and safeguards:
sharing.note: We may disclose information if required by law or to protect rights, safety, and integrity of {{brand}} and users. We do not share personal data with advertisers to serve you targeted ads in third-party products.

cookies.title: 5. Cookies & tracking
cookies.controls: You can control cookies in your browser and in the app’s <privacyLink>{{privacy}}</privacyLink>. If you opt out of analytics, we will stop sending event data except strictly necessary events for security and core functionality.
cookies.dnt: We honor applicable “Do Not Track/Global Privacy Control” signals for non-essential tracking where required.

choices.title: 6. Your choices & rights

items.manage: Access, correct, export, or delete your data in <accountLink>{{account}}</accountLink> or by email.
items.optout: Opt out of analytics and marketing emails in <privacyLink>{{privacy}}</privacyLink> or via links in emails.
items.rights: GDPR/UK: rights to access/rectify/erase/restrict/object/portability; CPRA: rights to know/delete/correct/limit use of sensitive data.

choices.contact: To exercise rights, contact us at {{email}}. We may need to verify your request.

retention.title: 7. Data retention
retention.text: We keep personal data only as long as necessary to provide the Service and for legitimate business or legal purposes. Typical examples: session logs (up to 30–90 days), analytics events (aggregated/limited retention), account records (while your account is active), and backups (time-limited rolling windows).

security.title: 8. Security

items.transport: Transport encryption (HTTPS/TLS) and encryption at rest where supported.
items.controls: Access controls, environment isolation, monitoring, and regular updates.

security.disclaimer: No method of transmission or storage is 100% secure; we work to continually improve protections.

international.title: 9. International transfers
international.text: Your data may be processed outside your country. Where applicable, we use safeguards like Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) and vendor addenda to protect cross-border transfers.

children.title: 10. Children
children.text: The Service is intended for users aged 16+ (or the age of digital consent in your region). We do not knowingly collect personal data from children under that age. If you believe a child has provided data, contact us to remove it.

changes.title: 11. Changes to this Policy
changes.text: We may update this Policy from time to time. Material changes will be highlighted in-app or via email. Your continued use after changes indicates acceptance.

contact.title: 12. Contact
contact.links: You can also review our <termsLink>{{terms}}</termsLink> and <adsLink>{{ads}}</adsLink>.
